medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset, progressively worsening crampy colicky abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began yesterday at about 10am following a meal containing corn the day before. The pain has progressively worsened and is currently located in the left mid abdomen. The patient also experienced nausea but did not vomit. She felt feverish and had chills without documenting a temperature. This is the first episode of such severe pain, although she has experienced abdominal cramping intermittently in the past.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, pyloric stenosis as an infant, previous pyloroplasty, cholecystectomy, lateral ventral wall herniorrhaphy, and bilateral orchiectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of lung cancer and had bowel disease requiring segmental resection; father died in an unspecified accident. Three siblings with non-contributory health issues.
